text:
Remark. The projection πU(x) ∈Rn is still an n-dimensional vector and
not a scalar. However, we no longer requirencoordinates to represent the
projection, but only a single one if we want to express it with respect to
the basis vector bthat spans the subspace U: λ. ♦
Draft (2019-10-15) of “Mathematics for Machine Learning”. Feedback:https://mml-book.com.
